title: Unable to Use MSSQL for connections
author: techarkit
body_snippet:
MSSQL Server 10.50.1600

Exception Message
"Value cannot be null or empty
Parameter name: cipherText"

Stack trace
   at mRemoteNG.Tools.Extensions.ThrowIfNullOrEmpty(String value, String argName) in C:\jenkins\workspace\Publish\Build mRemoteNG for Release\mRemoteV1\Tools\Extensions.cs:line 51
   at mRemoteNG.Security.Authentication.PasswordAuthenticator..ctor(ICryptographyProvider cryptographyProvider, String cipherText, Func`1 authenticationRequestor) in C:\jenkins\workspace\Publish\Bu...

comments.snippet:
After deleting database and re-created with new SQL script, able to connect database however unable to create new connections.

ErrorMsg
09/23/2019 11:18:14
Couldn't save connections file as ""!
The given ColumnMapping does not match up with any column in the source or destination.

comments.snippet:
Hi,
I have the same problem:
"Couldn't save connections file as ""! The given ColumnMapping does not match up with any column in the source or destination."
I'm using mRemoteNG 1.76.18.26260 an MS SQL Server Standard 12.0.6293.0.
Any help would be appreciated.
Solutions on https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/408 didn't help.
comments.author: CarstenFabian

comments.snippet: I think the last change on database behaviour in the development branch would fix it.
comments.author: Filippo125

comments.snippet:
I also have this issue. Brand new database the user has db_owner permission to. mRemoteNG 1.77.0.41252. 

I copied the script from the readthedocs using the 'latest' version. However I had to edit the readthedocs to be:
"        [Favorite] int NOT NULL,"
instead of:
"        [Favorite] tinyint(1) NOT NULL,"
before the script would complete successfully.
